intro: Plantago afra subsp. afra, commonly known as African plantain, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. The species is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
